February 21 at 2:22 PM ·

The 2020 United States Census counts every person living in the 50 states, District of Columbia, and five U.S. territories. The count is mandated by the Constitution and is conducted by the U.S. Census Bureau, a nonpartisan government agency.

In mid-March, homes across the country will begin receiving invitations to complete the 2020 Census. You’ll be asked to count everyone who lives in your home as of April 1. Once the invitation arrives, you can respond for your home in one of three ways: online, by phone, or by mail.

Learn more:

We want to share with you this story from Mrs. Walkenbach’s Second Grade class at Mark Twain:
“Yesterday, we talked about how in second grade we “get what we need, not just what we want.”
To start the conversation, each student told a time they got hurt and where the injury was. I simply said "I'm so sorry to hear that. Let's get you a band aid." No matter where the injury was (head, arms, knees, elbows) everyone got a band aid on their hand.
There was confusion at first, but then we talked about how I DID give each a band aid so they should be perfectly fine! The students, on their own, agreed they all got band aids, but it wasn't okay because they didn't get them where they NEEDED them. This led to a great discussion about self awareness and knowing what they need (educationally and emotionally) and how teachers try to make sure each person gets what they NEED even when they may not WANT to do what teachers ask.”
This is a great example of how in Brentwood, we see each child and support them along their individual pathway! Thanks to Mrs. Walkenbach for sharing!
